intro: Schellolepis lachnopus, commonly known as the red-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to deep red, often with a distinctive yellowish or greenish tinge. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Schellolepis lachnopus is often found in rocky outcrops and along the edges of shrublands.
